info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:26PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, Jackson, southern Madison, Swain, eastern Graham, Haywood and northwestern Buncombe Counties through 400 PM EST... At 325 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Newport to 4 miles southeast of Robbinsville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Sylva, Waynesville, Bryson City, Marshall, Cherokee, Canton, Cullowhee, Lake Junaluska and Clyde. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
